intro: Agalmyla wekariensis, commonly known as the Wekari sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in rocky outcrops. Agalmyla wekariensis is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
